pros: Every single person is lovely and happy to help you in the pharmacy department. All questions are valid, no one is condescending, and everyone has a positive attitude and remembers your name and where you're from. Hats off to the level of hospitality shown in the pharmacy department. I 100% recommend this hospital to any out-of-state technician looking to relocate and/or run away to the mountains.
cons: 10.5 hour days--which aren't even that bad of a con. Just a little inconvenience for single parents and folks with dogs at home.

pros:
Ethics and compliance is a major emphasis at Logan Health.
The people are amazing - I truly enjoyed nearly everyone I worked with
cons:
Sometimes their eagerness to show the government that they're being ethical and compliant leads them to not try to find creative (but still legal) ways to help patients.
Flathead County is horrible for masking and other public health compliance - including by MDs (as in, the staff are terrible at wearing their masks, at getting patients to wear masks, and some staff don't even do hand hygiene between patients - yikes!)

review_title: Probably not the worst place ever
pros: The nurse, doctors, and all staff are very strong and experienced. Everyone is very nice. It makes for an enjoyable work environment.
cons: Administration is going through a lot of changes and it doesn’t always feel like they are on the side of the front line staff. Low pay.

job_title: Clinic Manager in Cut Bank, MT
pros: I've worked at Logan Health-Cut Bank for three months. I am so grateful to find this job. Logan Health-Cut Bank is a hidden gem. The culture is so positive and caring. The company truly cares about their employees not only on a professional level, but also a personal level. The leadership team have so many conversations with you about what motivates you to help achieve your goals. Employees feel valued and that their voices are heard. Management lives the quote, "The strength of the team is each individual member. The strength of each member is the team." Recommend LH-Cut Bank to anyone.
cons: Company uses old EMR system with no automated system, however, currently working on the issue.

job_title: Mental Health Specialist in Kalispell, MT
pros: Orientation and training was great
cons: Work/life balance is is dire need

pros: Great benefits.  Great food and wonderful people to work with.
cons: Don't work here!  Very "clicky" and very closed-mind to new ideas.  Leadership is MICRO-managing.  They are very selective and have favorites.  HR is very non-supportive.  Senior leadership is so far removed and clueless about what really happens in the trenches.  I hope that you never will have a negative experience and have your boss tells you that you are worthless, because it was your idea for change -- then takes credit for your ideas.  It's the good 'ol girls club!!

pros: Decent benefits. Just decent. Construction workers with contract company on site  actually have better benefits. The providers are great. Don’t let the mid-management cloud the great care.
cons: Wages are usually not comparable to role. Room for growth is marginal unless you have a supervisor that believes in teamwork. Management is more interested in covering their own tails than doing a good job. Speaking directly and openly about issues puts a target on your back. Innovation, new approaches, transparent communication might just get you in hot water.

review_title: Horrible Place to work if you want job security
job_title: Senior Patient Account Representative in Kalispell, MT
pros: The benefits were decent, not sure about now.
cons: They expected you to donate money out of your hard earned paychecks to every cause to make the hospital look better but didn't want to pay you what you were worth.  Every time you turn around they were threatening to take away pay.  Too many legal troubles to mention.  People promoted who should not have been, lets just say that they were promoted because they were either with the right person or friends with the right person.  So it was high school all over again.  People were not promoted because they knew how to do the job or had the work experience.

pros: Benefits are ok. They reimburse employees for education to further their careers.
cons: Management  style is micromanage. People who have little qualifications are promoted into management.  For being in health-care benefits could be better.

pros: Great pay and nice environment to work in. The management is really professional. Easy to get time off and scheduling is flexible
cons: Very Difficult to get more than 16 hours a week. They hire too many lifeguards which takes away from your ability to work alot. Boring job at times.

pros: Excellent Benefits, good pay for Montana. Light work loads mean not feeling rushed with you're patients.
